meanings.definition: A thick, malleable mixture of flour and liquid used for baking bread or pastry.
meanings.sent1: Mom kneaded the dough to make delicious bread.
meanings.sent2: The baker rolled out the dough to form perfect croissants.
meanings.sent3: The dough looked like a fluffy cloud waiting to be baked.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity rose like dough in the oven, expanding with each idea.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked dough filled the kitchen, tempting everyone.

meanings.sent1: He saved up enough dough to buy a new bike.
meanings.sent2: The thief stole the bag of dough from the bank.
meanings.sent3: She found a wallet full of dough on the street and returned it to the owner.
meanings.sent4: His dough dwindled quickly after he splurged on a fancy dinner.
meanings.sent5: The sound of coins clinking together signaled the arrival of dough in his pocket.
